com.chaining

Class Guard<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.chaining.Guard<T>

  • public class Guard<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    start a Chain that executes crashing code safely, you should provide onErrorReturn(Function) or onErrorReturnItem(Object) to provide a fallback item if a crash occurred, or you can call onError(Consumer) to handle the Exception (if thrown) and finish the functions chain

    Created by Ahmed Adel Ismail on 11/1/2017.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> Guard<T> call(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> callable)
      execute the passed Callable safely, which will handle any thrown Exception internally, you will need to call onErrorReturnItem(Object) or onErrorReturn(Function) to continue chaining the function calls, or you can call onError(Consumer) to finish the chain
      void onError(io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<java.lang.Exception> consumer)
      provide a Consumer to be invoked when an Exception is thrown, this function will end the current functions chain, if you need to continue the chain with another operations, you can use onErrorReturn(Function) or onErrorReturnItem(Object)
      Chain<T> onErrorReturn(io.reactivex.functions.Function<java.lang.Throwable,T> function)
      provide a Function that will return a fallback item if the Callable that was passed to this Guard crashed
      Chain<T> onErrorReturnItem(T item)
      provide a fallback item if the Callable that was passed to this Guard crashed

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • call

        public static <T> Guard<T> call(@NonNull
                                java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> callable)
        execute the passed Callable safely, which will handle any thrown Exception internally, you will need to call onErrorReturnItem(Object) or onErrorReturn(Function) to continue chaining the function calls, or you can call onError(Consumer) to finish the chain
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the returned item
        Parameters:
        callable - a Callable that may crash
        Returns:
        a Guard to handle fallback scenarios

      • onErrorReturnItem

        public Chain<T> onErrorReturnItem(@NonNull
                                  T item)
        provide a fallback item if the Callable that was passed to this Guard crashed
        Parameters:
        item - the fallback item
        Returns:
        a Chain to continue the flow

      • onErrorReturn

        public Chain<T> onErrorReturn(@NonNull
                              io.reactivex.functions.Function<java.lang.Throwable,T> function)
        provide a Function that will return a fallback item if the Callable that was passed to this Guard crashed
        Parameters:
        function - the function that will provide the fallback item
        Returns:
        a Chain to continue the flow

      • onError

        public void onError(io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<java.lang.Exception> consumer)
        provide a Consumer to be invoked when an Exception is thrown, this function will end the current functions chain, if you need to continue the chain with another operations, you can use onErrorReturn(Function) or onErrorReturnItem(Object)
        Parameters:
        consumer - a Consumer to handle the Exception
